        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>AWS account ID of the subscription's owner.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_pending_confirmation_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_pending_confirmation_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">pending_<wbr>confirmation</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Whether the subscription has not been confirmed.</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_protocol_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_protocol_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">protocol</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Protocol to use. Valid values are: <code>sqs</code>, <code>sms</code>, <code>lambda</code>, <code>firehose</code>, and <code>application</code>. Protocols <code>email</code>, <code>email-json</code>, <code>http</code> and <code>https</code> are also valid but partially supported. See details below.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_raw_message_delivery_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_raw_message_delivery_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">raw_<wbr>message_<wbr>delivery</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Whether to enable raw message delivery (the original message is directly passed, not wrapped in JSON with the original message in the message property). Default is <code>false</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_redrive_policy_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_redrive_policy_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">redrive_<wbr>policy</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>JSON String with the redrive policy that will be used in the subscription. Refer to the <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/sns-dead-letter-queues.html#how-messages-moved-into-dead-letter-queue">SNS docs</a> for more details.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_replay_policy_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_replay_policy_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">replay_<wbr>policy</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>JSON String with the archived message replay policy that will be used in the subscription. Refer to the <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/message-archiving-and-replay-subscriber.html">SNS docs</a> for more details.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_subscription_role_arn_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_subscription_role_arn_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">subscription_<wbr>role_<wbr>arn</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>ARN of the IAM role to publish to Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream. Refer to <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/sns-firehose-as-subscriber.html">SNS docs</a>.</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_topic_python">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str | str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>ARN of the SNS topic to subscribe to.</p>

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import SNS Topic Subscriptions using the subscription `arn`. For example:

```sh
$ pulumi import aws:sns/topicSubscription:TopicSubscription user_updates_sqs_target arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:my-topic:8a21d249-4329-4871-acc6-7be709c6ea7f
```


To learn more about importing existing cloud resources, see [Importing resources](/docs/using-pulumi/adopting-pulumi/import/).
